name: Introduction to Electrical Engineering
description: This course introduces students to basic principles of electrical engineering. Topics include: voltage, current, power, resistance, capacitance, inductance, Fourier analysis, basic circuit analysis, and introduction to circuit simulation.

name: Circuits and Systems
description: This course covers advanced circuit analysis and design techniques. Topics include: Laplace transforms, network theorems, AC steady-state analysis, resonant circuits, frequency response, Bode plots, transfer functions, two-port circuits, power transfer, signal flow graphs, and introduction to filters.

name: Electronics I
description: This course covers the fundamentals of electronic devices and circuit design. Topics include: diodes, bipolar junction transistors, field-effect transistors, MOSFET amplifiers, and analysis and design of simple transistor circuits.

name: Electromagnetic Fields and Waves
description: This course covers the fundamentals of electromagnetic fields and waves. Topics include: electrostatics, magnetostatics, electromagnetic waves, transmission lines, waveguides, and antennas.

name: Control Systems
description: This course covers control systems theory and design. Topics include: system modeling and analysis, stability, performance specifications, feedback control, PID control, frequency response methods, state-space methods, and digital control.

name: Digital Signal Processing
description: This course covers theory and applications of digital signal processing. Topics include: discrete-time signals and systems, z-transforms, Fourier analysis of discrete-time signals, digital filter design, and spectral analysis.

name: Communication Systems
description: This course covers theory and design of communication systems. Topics include: signal representation, modulation techniques, noise and its effects on communication, detection theory, probability theory, error-correcting codes, channel capacity, and multiple-access techniques.

name: Power Systems
description: This course covers the analysis and design of electrical power systems. Topics include: power system components, power flow analysis, fault analysis, stability analysis, and power system protection.

name: Renewable Energy Systems
description: This course covers the design and operation of renewable energy systems. Topics include: solar energy, wind energy, hydro energy, geothermal energy, and bioenergy.

name: Microelectronics
description: This course covers the design and fabrication of microelectronic devices and integrated circuits. Topics include: semiconductor physics, MOSFETs, bipolar junction transistors, device modeling, CMOS logic gates, and digital integrated circuit design.

name: Senior Design Project
description: This course provides students with the opportunity to design, build and test a large-scale electrical engineering project. Students will work in teams to design a system to meet certain specifications, build and test the system, and present their work to the class.
